active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, analyze how inadequate change integrity management contributed to the SolarWinds breach. Propose three mitigation strategies using NIST CM-3 and CM-4, and debate their effectiveness in a zero-trust architecture.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in NIST-aligned content. Generate 25 high-quality flashcards on 'Change Integrity Management' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Information System Lifecycle > Development and Implementation > Developer Configuration Management (SA-10) > Change Integrity Management). Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [paste the 6 objectives above]. - Scaffolding Layers: [paste the 4 layers above, including prior knowledge, big picture, full CM controls list (CM-2 to CM-13), process steps]. - Active Learning: Draw from discussion (SolarWinds), peer teaching (CM-3/4), problem-solving (patch scenario) for scenario questions. - Sources: NIST SP 800-53r5 (https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/53/r5/upd1/final), SP 800-128 (https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/128/final), SP 800-53 SA-10. Output exactly 25 flashcards in JSON array, each following this schema: {'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'layer': '...', 'distractors': ['opt1', 'opt2', 'opt3']}, 'control': '...'}. Ensure coverage: 6-8 per Bloom pair (Remember/Understand, Apply/Analyze, Evaluate/Create); 6+ per layer; 50% MCQ with distractors; progressive difficulty; voter priorities (completeness on controls, pedagogy).
